name: Specially Adapted Housing Assistive Technology Grant Program
popular_name: Specially Adapted Housing Assistive Technology (SAHAT) Grant Program
objective: Pursuant to the Veterans’ Benefit Act of 2010, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs (Secretary), through the Loan Guaranty Service (LGY) of the Veterans Benefits Administration (VBA), is authorized to provide grants of financial assistance to develop new assistive technology. The objective of the grant, known as the Specially Adapted Housing Assistive Technology (SAHAT) Grant Program, is to encourage the development of new assistive technologies for specially adapted housing grant participants. In particular, Veterans that have loss the use of their upper or lower extremities, and blindness.
beneficiary_types: Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)
applicant_types: Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)

results.description: In FY 19, 4 grants were awarded.  (FY 20 est.: 5; FY 21 est.: 0 grants
For a list of awarded projects, please visit: https://www.benefits.va.gov/HOMELOANS/sahat_awards.asp
The Specially Adapted Housing Assistive Technology Grant continues to provide innovative solutions to activities of daily living for the Specially Adapted Housing participants.

authorizations.text: Veterans’ Benefits Act of 2010. Pub. L. 111, 275. 38 U.S.C. § 2108.
